meanings.definition: To confess or acknowledge something is true
meanings.sent1: I must admit that I ate the last cookie.
meanings.sent2: She admitted her mistake and apologized.
meanings.sent3: The cat had to admit defeat when it couldn't catch the laser pointer.
meanings.sent4: The evidence was overwhelming, forcing him to admit his guilt.
meanings.sent5: He had to admit the truth, even though it was difficult.

meanings.definition: To allow someone to enter a place
meanings.sent1: The security guard will admit you into the concert venue.
meanings.sent2: Please admit the guests into the party.
meanings.sent3: The door refused to admit anyone without the secret password.
meanings.sent4: The key finally admitted the lock and allowed the door to open.
meanings.sent5: The gatekeeper admitted the travelers into the castle.

meanings.definition: To accept someone into a group or organization
meanings.sent1: The club will admit new members next month.
meanings.sent2: They admitted her into the prestigious organization.
meanings.sent3: The secret society only admits those who can solve the riddle.
meanings.sent4: The exclusive club admitted him after a thorough interview.
meanings.sent5: The team decided to admit the talented player into their ranks.
